Description: Fragment of gold twisted wire of square cross-section with a tapering tip bent inwards like a hook; probably a fitting from a piece of jewellery. The other end, also bent, is broken and missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: "Gold wire, square, twisted" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 110, pl. xli, 28; see also ibid., p. 76 § 73-74.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 110, pl. xli, 28)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.84, p.186, pl.28)
